trans-unit.source: Rights Management Sharing Application for Windows
trans-unit.target: Rights Management Sharing Application for Windows

trans-unit.source: The Rights Management sharing application for Windows (also known as just “the RMS sharing app”) is a free, downloadable application for organizations that use <link><linkText>Active Directory Rights Management Services</linkText><title></title></link> (AD RMS) or <link><linkText>Azure Rights Management</linkText><title></title></link> (Azure RMS), and for organizations that don’t have their own information protection infrastructure but want to consume content that has been protected by other organizations that use Azure RMS.
trans-unit.target: The Rights Management sharing application for Windows (also known as just “the RMS sharing app”) is a free, downloadable application for organizations that use <link><linkText>Active Directory Rights Management Services</linkText><title></title></link> (AD RMS) or <link><linkText>Azure Rights Management</linkText><title></title></link> (Azure RMS), and for organizations that don’t have their own information protection infrastructure but want to consume content that has been protected by other organizations that use Azure RMS.

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Rights Management sharing application: Version release history</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Rights Management sharing application: Version release history</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: There’s also a Rights Management sharing app for Mac computers and mobile devices.
trans-unit.target: There’s also a Rights Management sharing app for Mac computers and mobile devices.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>FAQ for Rights Management Sharing Application for Mobile and Mac Platforms</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>FAQ for Rights Management Sharing Application for Mobile and Mac Platforms</linkText><title></title></link>.
